description: Rules for extracting Count (number of units in package) from product title
instructions: Extract the NUMBER OF UNITS in the package. Look for numbers before unit keywords like 'capsules', 'tablets', 'softgels', etc. Be careful NOT to confuse dosage (mg, IU) with count.

examples.title: Fish Oil 1000mg 180 Softgels
examples.reasoning: Found '180 softgels' - the count is 180 (not 1000, which is dosage)

examples.title: Vitamin D 5000 IU 60 Capsules
examples.reasoning: Found '60 capsules' - the count is 60 (not 5000, which is dosage in IU)

examples.title: Elderberry Syrup 8 fl oz
examples.reasoning: Found '8 fl oz' - the count is 8 (volume measurement)

examples.title: Whey Protein Powder 2 lbs
examples.reasoning: Found '2 lbs' - the count is 2 (weight measurement, will be converted to OZ)

examples.title: Creatine Monohydrate 500 g
examples.reasoning: Found '500 g' - the count is 500 grams (will be converted to OZ)

examples.title: Multivitamin Gummy
examples.reasoning: No count information found in title

warnings: CRITICAL: Do NOT confuse dosage numbers (mg, mcg, IU, mcg/ml) with count.
CRITICAL: Look for the number that comes BEFORE unit keywords (capsules, tablets, softgels, oz).
CRITICAL: If you see multiple numbers, choose the one associated with units, NOT dosage.
Example: 'CoQ10 100mg 60 Capsules' â†’ Count is 60 (not 100, not 10 from CoQ10)
